TEXT: The applicants , ORG and ORG , are NORP citizens who were born in DATE and DATE , respectively , and live in GPE . They were represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON and Mr GPE , lawyers practising in GPE .
ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON .
In DATE the property which is at issue in this case was nationalised pursuant to ORG DATE , which provided for the nationalisation of all property belonging to foreign nationals .

On DATE the applicants filed a property claim with ORG against the local authorities . The applicants claimed that their predecessor had bought the disputed property in DATE from PERSON , a NORP citizen , and that therefore that property could not have been nationalised . The disputed fact in the case was the actual existence of the purchase contract , as it had allegedly been destroyed .
In the claim form , they assessed the monetary value of their claim at MONEY ” ( YUR - approximately CARDINAL,CARDINAL NORP marks ( ORG ) at the time ) .
On DATE the court ruled in favour of the applicants . That decision was upheld by ORG on DATE .
At the request of the Attorney General of GPE , on DATE ORG ( " ORG " ) quashed the judgments of DATE and DATE and remitted the case for a retrial .
On DATE the applicants extended their claim to the ORG .
On DATE ORG ruled against the applicants . That decision was upheld by ORG on DATE .
On DATE ORG rejected the ORG appeal on points of law on the ground that they had failed to assess the monetary value of their claim in the claim form .
The Government did not dispute the facts submitted by the applicants . However , they provided additional information concerning the proceedings before ORG , as follows .
On DATE the applicants applied for the reopening of the proceedings before ORG .

On DATE ORG accepted their application and quashed its decision of DATE . At the same time , it decided on the merits of the applicants’ appeal on points of law and dismissed it as manifestly ill - founded .
The ORG representative was served with ORG decision on DATE .
